thread.title: 5,000 workers get Dubai moving again after heavy rain
thread.title_full: 5,000 workers get Dubai moving again after heavy rain

title: 5,000 workers get Dubai moving again after heavy rain
text:
5,000 workers get Dubai moving again after heavy rain Staff Reporter /Dubai Filed on February 27, 2017 | Last updated on February 27, 2017 at 05.41 pm Share Vote 
(Supplied photo) An emergency plan was prepared quickly and suction pumps were distributed in Jumeirah, Al Quoz Industrial area, Muhaisnah and Al Aweer. About 5,000 Dubai Municipality workers cleaned up 265 affected locations, as the team responded to 22 complaints of water logging, it was announced on Tuesday. Don't miss it: Look what 30mm rains have done to Dubai He noted that the team of 5,000 workers from different municipality departments arranged 48 tanks for the areas not served by the network, 35 tanks in Dubai city alone and the rest in the countryside. He added that the team was prepared for emergency situations based on the meteorological reports and rain forecast on the emirate. Now that's funny: KHDA humours Dubai students after heavy rain "An emergency plan was prepared quickly and suction pumps were distributed in Jumeirah, Al Quoz Industrial area, Muhaisnah and Al Aweer so as to remove the water from the streets in areas where there are drainages. Also some 95 suction pumps were distributed to drain the water faster," said Julfar.
